Thailand's Health Minister said that the country
plans to ban the use of cannabis for
recreational purposes before the end of
this year but will continue to allow its use
for medicinal purposes.
This move was made after
Thai authorities admitted
negative consequences for allowing the
use of marijuana in Thailand. Thailand was the
first country in Southeast Asia to
legalize marijuana for use.  for educational purposes
in 2018 and then used for
entertainment in 2022. According to the new law, the
act of using marijuana for recreational purposes
will be subject to a fine of up to 60,000 baht,
or about 42 million VND, for marijuana sellers.  x
for entertainment purposes and engage in
advertising or marketing of ingredients of K
cannabis or cannabis smoking devices and
face a prison sentence of up to 1 year or a
fine of up to 100,000 baht approximately 70 million
VND or both  The two Nanka school ministries
admitted that marijuana abuse has a
negative impact on Thai children in the long term.
